atm.controller

Class ATMController

  • java.lang.Object
    • atm.controller.AbstractController
      • atm.controller.ATMController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class ATMController
extends AbstractController
    This is the ATMController for the views. This contains the actions that the user can perform once they have logged into their account.
    Since:
    2015-03-25
    Author:
    Chris Wells

      void getAccounts() 
      boolean login(char[] cs)
      The login function allows the user to login to their account based on a card swipe and the correct PIN entered into the system.
      void operation(java.lang.String opt)
      The function operation initiates what function the user has selected to perform (withdraw, cancel, etc.)
      void SetFromAccount(Results a)

      The transferFunds function allows the user to transfer funds from one account to another.
      void withdrawFunds(Results account, java.lang.Double amount)
      The withdrawFunds function allows the user to withdraw funds from one account they select from their available accounts.

    • Method Detail

      • operation

        public void operation(java.lang.String opt)
        The function operation initiates what function the user has selected to perform (withdraw, cancel, etc.)
        Parameters:
        opt - String that is passed from the view

      • login

        public boolean login(char[] cs)
        The login function allows the user to login to their account based on a card swipe and the correct PIN entered into the system. The card number and PIN are validated against the database to look for a match.
        Parameters:
        cs - the card swipe information
        Returns:
        boolean if the login was a success or not

      • transferFunds

        public void transferFunds(Results account1,
                          Results account2,
                          java.lang.Double amount)
        The transferFunds function allows the user to transfer funds from one account to another. The user must select two accounts (to, from) and pass in the amount they'd like to transfer.
        Parameters:
        account1 - The from account
        account2 - The to account
        amount - The amount they'd like to transfer

      • withdrawFunds

        public void withdrawFunds(Results account,
                          java.lang.Double amount)
        The withdrawFunds function allows the user to withdraw funds from one account they select from their available accounts.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that the money will be withdrawn from
        amount - The amount that will be withdrawn
